text.2_Daf, 4_Line, 12_Comment: R' Yehoshua ben Levi said (in the name of R' Raish Lakish)
text.2_Daf, 1_Line, 0_Comment: Regarding this certain individual: [who is a] kohen.
text.2_Daf, 1_Line, 2_Comment: It is not said: If they were made to be plotters and they are Kohanim. Make this one [the plotters] the son of a divorcee or Halutzah: To fulfill "Like they plotted". He takes on forty lashes: in the Gemara the reason will be explained.
text.12_Daf, 46_Line, 1_Comment: He was lowering a barrel: from the roof.
text.2_Daf, 4_Line, 14_Comment: [So] then revoke just his priesthood and not his offspring's,
text.2_Daf, 4_Line, 6_Comment: It was taught previously [in the end of Sanhedrin]
text.2_Daf, 4_Line, 8_Comment: ...[now our Mishnah continues] and [then] there are false witnesses who are not given [this kind of] punishment at all, rather they receive forty lashes.
text.2_Daf, 4_Line, 5_Comment: [the definition of a false witness] But they [different witnesses come and] say to them [the false witnesses]. 'How can you testify? On that day and in that place, you were with us [in a different place, and therefore lying].
text.12_Daf, 10_Line, 0_Comment: If we were: around in the time that court would rule in capital cases no one would ever get executed as the gemara explains that they would cross-examine the witnesses in matters that they would not know how to answer.
text.2_Daf, 4_Line, 0_Comment: MISHNA: How are witnesses [which come before a rabbinical court to testify] made zomemim [false witnesses]?
text.11_Daf, 24_Line, 0_Comment: From his own mouth: The victim himself warned him.
text.2_Daf, 4_Line, 7_Comment: Every false witness is punished the same [punishment that they tried to cause], except for the case of accusing a Cohen's daughter of adultery...
text.13_Daf, 13_Line, 0_Comment: He did it accidentally: And how to you call it willful?
text.8_Daf, 2_Line, 0_Comment: MISHNA: They divide the monetary payment: As [the mishna] will go on to explain.
text.2_Daf, 4_Line, 3_Comment: GEMARA: Why does the Mishna ask 'How do witnesses become false witnesses?' [since this is not the topic of the Mishnah]
text.12_Daf, 0_Line, 0_Comment: Illah and Toviah: [were] witnesses on a loan and they were related to the guarantor.
text.2_Daf, 2_Line, 0_Comment: That is ruled for [the penalty of] Exile: That he killed someone negligently.
text.11_Daf, 8_Line, 0_Comment: GEMARA: An isolated testimony: [The case where] one [witness] saw from this window, and one [witness] saw from this window, but they do not one another.
text.13_Daf, 23_Line, 5_Comment: Excludes one who intended to throw two and threw four: And similarly one who threw four and threw eight.
text.2_Daf, 4_Line, 10_Comment: Witnesses testify that this person is a son of a divorcee or a son of a Levirite marriage. We don't say that they [the false witnesses] become like a son of a divorcee or a son of a Levirite marriage, rather they are lashed forty times.
text.9_Daf, 2_Line, 0_Comment: Where they already killed: the first group [of witnesses] before the second group came in.
text.13_Daf, 28_Line, 0_Comment: So too all [cases] that have permission for the victim etc.: This excludes the a privately owned courtyard.
text.2_Daf, 1_Line, 1_Comment: That he is he son of a divorcee: In our presence his mother got divorced before he was born, and therefore he is a Challal [Illegitimate Kohen] and disqualified [from kohen services].
text.8_Daf, 24_Line, 1_Comment: And they found them to be zomemim: These second [set of witnesses] that made the first set into zomemim, also made this later [set of witnesses] into zomemim.
text.2_Daf, 4_Line, 15_Comment: [but] the laws of false witnesses requires the same punishment, and it is missing here.
text.8_Daf, 24_Line, 0_Comment: If others came: That they [these new witnesses] gave testimony like the first group of witnesses.
text.9_Daf, 10_Line, 0_Comment: She has been established: to bring in false witnesses, and we should no longer accept any addition witnesses.
text.11_Daf, 42_Line, 0_Comment: Foreigners: of a different tongue which the judges didn't recognize.
text.2_Daf, 4_Line, 1_Comment: Witnesses [proven false] testify that this person is a son of a divorcee or a son of a Levirite marriage. We don't say that they become like a son of a divorcee or a son of a Levirite marriage, rather they are lashed forty times.
text.37_Daf, 11_Line, 0_Comment: This is how we read it: And as for where one is scripturally warned against it's consumption, to not eat from it in tumah, I do not know. The Torah says, "Do not proceed etc.": This is the wording found in the sifre. Ans when it was established here, there was not [time given] to complete it before the Gemara asked, "Why bodily tumah is explicitly written! 'And he may not eat from any holy until he washes etc.'" And we establish in Yevamos that this is referring to maaser from what is written "for if he washed" which would imply that if he did wash he would be tahor, that he immersed, ascended and eats maaser [sheni]. (Our Master, his body was tahor, and his soul exited in a state of tahora. He did not explain any further. From here and on is the words of his disciple Rebbi Yehuda bar Nassan.) This is the wording of the baraisa, to say, "I do not know where one is scriptually warned", therefore the Torah teaches us, "he may not proceed etc.", and the Gemarah was not quiet yet in finishing the matter, rather it proceeded and asked why does it say "I do not know"? Why, bodily tumah is explicitly written in the Torah, "the soul that touched it. etc. may not eat from the holy unless he washed his flesh in water", and we say in Yevamos, that this verse was said regarding maaser sheni, that he immersed, ascended and eats etc.
text.2_Daf, 4_Line, 13_Comment: And you shall do to him as HE plotted, [meaning] to him, and not to his offspring.
text.2_Daf, 0_Line, 0_Comment: MISHNA: How are witnesses made zomemim? etc.: In the Gemarah it will be explained what this is saying.
text.9_Daf, 6_Line, 0_Comment: Alone: implies that they were others.
text.2_Daf, 3_Line, 0_Comment: GEMARAH: This is how we read it: Why! How are witnesses not made zomimen, it should have asked, and forthermore, as we will teach later on, (Makkos 5a) but if they said to him etc.
text.13_Daf, 45_Line, 0_Comment: Let us say that it is subject to a tannaic dispute: this question of Rebbi Abahu.
text.9_Daf, 36_Line, 0_Comment: GEMARA: Berebi says: this was his name.
text.2_Daf, 4_Line, 4_Comment: and furthermore, later on we learn
text.2_Daf, 3_Line, 1_Comment: How are witnesses not made zomemim we should have asked: In which we can not maintain the requirement of K'asher Zamam [As they plotted].
text.2_Daf, 4_Line, 17_Comment: It stands to reason, a fortiori, since a priest who successfully takes away priesthood from his fellow keeps his priesthood, a priest who is unsuccessful remains a priest.
text.2_Daf, 4_Line, 19_Comment: if so, false witnesses can never be punished.
text.12_Daf, 12_Line, 0_Comment: Even: If you would have done this you would have increased murder in Isreal because people would no longer fear court.
text.2_Daf, 4_Line, 2_Comment: Witnesses testify that this person is subject to exile, we don't say that they [the false witnesses] are exiled in his place, rather they are lashed forty times.
text.13_Daf, 23_Line, 1_Comment: That he pushed him with his body: without intent.
text.9_Daf, 32_Line, 0_Comment: To do their brother: implies that their brother is yet alive.
